page.title: 13ENTERTAINMENT IN LEADENHAM
page.content: Leadenham Players was formed in 1980.There had previously been a group of villagers who had performed pantomines in the village hall with the very limited facilities.Growing interest,and the arrival of an ex professional actress prompted the forming of the company.The first job was to build a stage.Curtains,lights and a piano were bought from funds raised by a raffle.It was felt that one production a year was not enough. A summer revue was a second venture. From revue material the group has progressed to short plays and taking part in local drama festivals.Now there are 20 adult members with the local primary school children joining. New ventures are tried as the group's ability improves.The Players provide a focus for like minded people and welcome entertainment for the Village.
